Field Detail

db

public com.db4o.ObjectContainer db
db4o database for node and client layer. Other databases can be created for the datastore (since its usage patterns and content are completely different), or for plugins (for security reasons).

nodeDBHandle

public long nodeDBHandle
A fixed random number which identifies the top-level objects belonging to this node, as opposed to any others that might be stored in the same database (e.g. because of many-nodes-in-one-VM).

Constant Field Values

lastBootID

public final long lastBootID
The bootID of the last time the node booted up. Or -1 if we don't know due to permissions problems, or we suspect that the node has been booted and not written the file e.g. if we can't write it. So if we want to compare data gathered in the last session and only recorded to disk on a clean shutdown to data we have now, we just include the lastBootID.

bootID

public final long bootID

routedPing

public int routedPing(double loc2,
                      byte[] nodeIdentity)
Do a routed ping of another node on the network by its location.

Parameters:
loc2 - The location of the other node to ping. It must match exactly.
Returns:
The number of hops it took to find the node, if it was found. Otherwise -1.

                                boolean canReadClientCache,
                                boolean canWriteClientCache)
Check the datastore, then if the key is not in the store, check whether another node is requesting the same key at the same HTL, and if all else fails, create a new RequestSender for the key/htl.

Parameters:
closestLocation - The closest location to the key so far.
localOnly - If true, only check the datastore.
Returns:
A KeyBlock if the data is in the store, otherwise a RequestSender, unless the HTL is 0, in which case NULL. RequestSender.

makeTurtle

public void makeTurtle(RequestSender sender)
Make a running request sender into a turtle request. Backoff: when the transfer finishes, or after 10 seconds if no cancellation. Downstream: Cancel all dependant RequestHandler's and local requests. This also removes it from the load management code. Registration: We track the turtles for each peer, and overall. No two turtles from the same node may share the same key, and there is an overall limit.

Parameters:
sender -

shouldStoreDeep

public boolean shouldStoreDeep(Key key,
                               PeerNode source,
                               PeerNode[] routedTo)
Should we commit the block to the store rather than the cache?

We used to check whether we are a sink by checking whether any peer has a closer location than we do. Then we made low-uptime nodes exempt from this calculation: if we route to a low uptime node with a closer location, we want to store it anyway since he may go offline. The problem was that if we routed to a low-uptime node, and there was another option that wasn't low-uptime but was closer to the target than we were, then we would not store in the store. Also, routing isn't always by the closest peer location: FOAF and per-node failure tables change it. So now, we consider the nodes we have actually routed to:

Store in datastore if our location is closer to the target than:

  1. the source location (if any, and ignoring if low-uptime)
  2. the locations of the nodes we just routed to (ditto)

Parameters:
key -
source -
routedTo -
Returns:

drawStoreStats

public void drawStoreStats(HTMLNode infobox)
